getRank().Description: Retrieves the rank returned from the server for this score. Note that this may not be exact and that multiple scores can have identical ranks. Lower ranks indicate a better score, with rank 1 being the best score on the board. If the score holder's rank cannot be determined, this will return @B_com#google#android#gms#games#leaderboard#LeaderboardScore#LEADERBOARD_RANK_UNKNOWN_E@.

Returns: The player associated with this leaderboard score.
getScoreHolder().Description: Retrieves the player that scored this particular score. The return value here may be null if the current player is not authorized to see information about the holder of this score. Note that this object is a volatile representation, so it is not safe to cache the output of this directly. Instead, cache the result of @B_com#google#android#gms#common#data#Freezable#freeze_E@.

Parameters: The buffer to load the data into.
getDisplayScore(android.database.CharArr.Description: Loads the formatted display score into the given @B_android#database#CharArrayBuffer_E@.

getDisplayScore().Description: Retrieves a formatted string to display for this score. The details of the formatting are specified by the developer in their dev console.

getDisplayRank().Description: Retrieves a formatted string to display for this rank. This handles appropriate localization and formatting.

Returns: The display name of the holder of this score.
getScoreHolderDisplayName().Description: Retrieves the name to display for the player who scored this score. If the identity of the player is unknown, this will return an anonymous name to display.

Returns: The score tag associated with this score.
getScoreTag().Description: Retrieve the optional score tag associated with this score, if any.

Returns: The URI of the hi-res image to display for this score.
getScoreHolderHiResImageUri().Description: Retrieves the URI of the hi-res image to display for the player who scored this score. If the identity of the player is unknown, this will return null. It may also be null if the player simply has no image. To retrieve the Image from the @B_android#net#Uri_E@, use @B_com#google#android#gms#common#images#ImageManager_E@.

Returns: Timestamp when this score was achieved.
getTimestampMillis().Description: Retrieves the timestamp (in milliseconds from epoch) at which this score was achieved.

Parameters: The buffer to load the data into.
getScoreHolderDisplayName(android.databa.Description: Load the display name of the player who scored this score into the provided @B_android#database#CharArrayBuffer_E@.

Parameters: The buffer to load the data into.
getDisplayRank(android.database.CharArra.Description: Load the formatted display rank into the given @B_android#database#CharArrayBuffer_E@.

Returns: The URI of the icon image to display for this score.
getScoreHolderIconImageUri().Description: Retrieves the URI of the icon image to display for the player who scored this score. If the identity of the player is unknown, this will return an anonymous image for the player. It may also be null if the player simply has no image. To retrieve the Image from the @B_android#net#Uri_E@, use @B_com#google#android#gms#common#images#ImageManager_E@.

ClassDesc: Data interface representing a single score on a leaderboard.
